dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey everyone, and welcome back to the podcast! We've got some pretty big news today, like, really shaking up the world of mobile payments, especially for travelers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey everyone, and welcome back to the podcast! We've got some pretty big news today, like, really shaking up the world of mobile payments, especially for travelers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Yeah, um, I saw this crossing my feed, it's pretty huge for anyone, you know, going internationally, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, um, I saw this crossing my feed, it's pretty huge for anyone, you know, going internationally, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. So, Kaspi.kz, which many of you will know as that huge Super App, they've just announced a new partnership with Alipay+.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. So, Kaspi.kz, which many of you will know as that huge Super App, they've just announced a new partnership with Alipay+.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joint Stock Company Kaspi.kz (Kaspi.kz) (Nasdaq: KSPI), which operates the Kaspi.kz Super App for consumers and Kaspi Pay Super App for merchants, today announces a new partnership with Alipay + to enable Kaspi.kz customers to pay using the Kaspi.kz Super App and QR code, throughout China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, Alipay+! Okay, so, uh, what does this actually mean for Kaspi.kz users?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, Alipay+! Okay, so, uh, what does this actually mean for Kaspi.kz users?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it means their customers can now pay using the Kaspi.kz Super App and a QR code, like, throughout *all* of China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it means their customers can now pay using the Kaspi.kz Super App and a Q R code, like, throughout all of China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Partnership with Alipay+ When travelling in China, Kazakhstanis no longer need to take cash or a card with them. Now, using the Kaspi.kz Super App, purchases in Chinese stores, cafes, taxis and more than 80 million points throughout China can be paid for by QR code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, so no more fumbling for cash or having to, um, exchange currency if you're traveling from Kazakhstan into China? That's, that's pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so no more fumbling for cash or having to, um, exchange currency if you're traveling from Kazakhstan into China? That's, that's pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When travelling in China, Kazakhstanis no longer need to take cash or a card with them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Mikhail Lomtadze, the CEO of Kaspi.kz, he actually said they get a lot of feedback from Kazakhstanis who work, study, or vacation in China, wanting to pay as easily abroad as they do back home.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Mikhail Lomtadze, the C E O of Kaspi.kz, he actually said they get a lot of feedback from Kazakhstanis who work, study, or vacation in China, wanting to pay as easily abroad as they do back home.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: CEO and Co-founder of Kaspi.kz Mikhail Lomtadze, commented: Many Kazakhstanis work, study and vacation in China. We constantly receive feedback from our customers - how nice it would be to pay for purchases abroad as easily as in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that makes total sense. I mean, we've all been there, right? Trying to, uh, navigate a new currency in a new country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that makes total sense. I mean, we've all been there, right? Trying to, uh, navigate a new currency in a new country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And now it’s for purchases in stores, cafes, taxis—like, over 80 million points across China can now be paid for with just a QR code.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And now it's for purchases in stores, cafes, taxis-like, over eighty million points across China can now be paid for with just a Q R code.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, using the Kaspi.kz Super App, purchases in Chinese stores, cafes, taxis and more than 80 million points throughout China can be paid for by QR code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Eighty million? Wow. So, how does it actually work in practice? Is it, uh, complicated to set up?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Eighty million? Wow. So, how does it actually work in practice? Is it, uh, complicated to set up?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Not at all. You just, um, open the Kaspi.kz app, select the Alipay+ service, and then either the seller scans your QR code, or you scan theirs. Super simple.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not at all. You just, um, open the Kaspi.kz app, select the Alipay+ service, and then either the seller scans your Q R code, or you scan theirs. Super simple.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To pay for purchases, Kaspi.kz customers just need to open the Kaspi.kz app, select the AliPay+ service and let the seller scan their QR code or alternatively buyers can scan the seller's QR code.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's slick. And Venetia Lee from Ant International, she, like, manages Greater China, right? She sounded pretty hyped about this too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's slick. And Venetia Lee from Ant International, she, like, manages Greater China, right? She sounded pretty hyped about this too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Venetia Lee, Greater China General Manager of Ant International, commented: Alipay+ is thrilled to announce our partnership with the first and leading e-wallet Super App in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: She definitely did. She said Alipay+ is thrilled to partner with Kazakhstan's leading e-wallet, and it's all about enabling a seamless mobile payment experience for their, um, very mobile-savvy users.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: She definitely did. She said Alipay+ is thrilled to partner with Kazakhstan's leading e-wallet, and it's all about enabling a seamless mobile payment experience for their, um, very mobile-savvy users.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Venetia Lee, Greater China General Manager of Ant International, commented: Alipay+ is thrilled to announce our partnership with the first and leading e-wallet Super App in Kazakhstan. Together we will enable a seamless mobile payment experience in the Chinese mainland for the many Kaspi.kz mobile-savvy users.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And it's not just about payments, is it? Like, it's about connecting people and communities through travel and trade, which is, uh, a bigger mission.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And it's not just about payments, is it? Like, it's about connecting people and communities through travel and trade, which is, uh, a bigger mission.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She added that, While this partnership will enhance the travel and shopping experience for Kaspi.kz users, we will continue to build on our innovative technology and service excellence to bring people and communities closer through travel, trade and commerce.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they're really pushing that. Kaspi.kz's whole mission is to, like, improve lives through innovative mobile products. They've got this two-sided Super App model for consumers and merchants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they're really pushing that. Kaspi.kz's whole mission is to, like, improve lives through innovative mobile products. They've got this two-sided Super App model for consumers and merchants.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kzs mission is to improve peoples lives by developing innovative mobile products and services. To deliver upon this, we operate a unique, two-sided Super App model Kaspi.kz Super App for consumers and Kaspi Pay Super App for merchants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And they're doing pretty well, too. Nasdaq listed since, uh, January 2024. Sounds like a really smart move for both companies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're doing pretty well, too. Nasdaq listed since, uh, January twenty twenty four. Sounds like a really smart move for both companies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz has been listed on Nasdaq since January 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It’s a prime example of how these super apps are, like, changing global commerce and travel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It's a prime example of how these super apps are, like, changing global commerce and travel.
